definitions: to become less intense or widespread
words.mnemonic: A-bate: the beat slows down (less intense).
Ben-evolent: Ben (a friendly person) is kind.

definitions: given to sudden changes of mood or behavior
words.example: Her capricious nature made planning difficult.
words.mnemonic: Capri-cious: imagine a goat on a whim (capricious).

definitions: to make someone feel intimidated or apprehensive
words.example: The task did not daunt her.
words.mnemonic: DAUNT: Danger? AUNT — imagine intimidating relative.

definitions: deriving ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources
having or displaying a passionate intensity
pay attention to; take notice of
in accordance with the highest standards; faultless
words.mnemonic: I'm-PECK-able: can't peck at any flaw.

definitions: place or deal with close together for contrasting effect
words.example: Black-and-white photos were juxtaposed with color images.
words.mnemonic: Juxta-POSE: put poses side by side.
